name: Food attitudes
helpText:
Below are 6 statements that people have mentioned about the food and drinks they eat, both out of home and in home. 
Q:Please select how much you personally agree or disagree with each statement

name: Visit frequency
helpText:
Approximately how many times every MONTH do you eat in restaurants at each of these times of day?
Q:Please move your mouse along the scale until it shows the right number in the box on the left and click.

name: Dietary requirements
helpText:
Would you describe yourself as having any of the following dietary requirements?
Q:Please select all that apply

name: TV Platforms
helpText: Which of the following TV platforms have you used in the last two weeks on any device e.g. TV, mobile, tablet, computer?

name: TV Channels
helpText: Which of the following TV channels have you watched in the last two weeks?

name: Program Genres
helpText: Which of the following types of TV programs do you typically watch? NOTE: This includes TV / video watched on your TV, mobile, tablet and computing

name: News Sources
helpText: Which of the following sources of news have you read in the last two weeks? NOTE: This includes both physical copies and online versions

name: Magazine Genres
helpText: Have you read any of the follow types of content in on magazines / websites in the last two weeks?

name: Radio Stations
helpText: Which of the following radio stations / podcasts have you listened to in the last two weeks? NOTE: This includes radio listened to across any device (e.g. radio, car radio, mobile, computer)

name: Sports Followed
helpText: To what extent to you follow the sports listed below?

name: Hobbies
helpText: Which of the following, if any, do you typically do in your spare time?

name: Cinema Visits
helpText: Have you seen a film at a cinema in the last two weeks?

name: Devices Owned
helpText: Which of the following devices do you own?

name: Apps Used
helpText: Which, if any, of the following online services have you used in the last two weeks?

name: Breakfast:Location of purchase
helpText: Thinking about breakfast yesterday, from what type of venue was your MAIN eating / drinking experience?

name: Breakfast:Channel of purchase
helpText: Which of the following best describes your MAIN breakfast eating / drinking experience yesterday?

name: Breakfast:Reason for purchase
helpText: Which best describes this breakfast occasion yesterday?

name: Breakfast:Weather
helpText: How would you describe the weather during this breakfast experience / visit yesterday?

name: Breakfast:Drinks purchased
helpText: What drinks, if any, did you personally have during this breakfast experience / visit yesterday?

name: Breakfast:Food purchased
helpText: What food, if any, did you personally eat during this breakfast experience / visit yesterday?

name: Breakfast:Personal spend
helpText: How much did you personally pay in total i.e. for all people in your party, for this breakfast experience yesterday?

helpText: Thinking about mid-morning yesterday, from what type of venue was your MAIN eating / drinking experience?

helpText: Thinking about the afternoon yesterday, from what type of venue was your MAIN eating / drinking experience?

helpText: Which of the following best describes your MAIN the afternoon eating / drinking experience yesterday?

helpText: Which best describes this the afternoon occasion yesterday?

helpText: How would you describe the weather during this the afternoon experience / visit yesterday?

helpText: What drinks, if any, did you personally have during this the afternoon experience / visit yesterday?

name: Summary:Summary scorecard
helpText: Performance across the factors that capture the overall performance of each brand.

name: Brand sample
helpText: Sample for key metrics for active brand

name: Brand attention: Brand attention scorecard
helpText: Performance across the factors that capture the level of excitement and attention around each brand.

name: Brand attention: BETA ONLY - Fast casuals
Positive buzz
helpText:
Those who have heard something positive about each brand in the last month (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: Which of the following have you heard something POSITIVE about in the last month?

name: Negative buzz
helpText:
Those who have heard something negative about each brand in the last month (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: Which of the following have you heard something NEGATIVE about in the last month?

name: Net buzz
helpText: The difference between positive and negative buzz

name: Buzz noise
helpText: The total of positive and negative buzz

name: Advertising awareness
helpText:
Those who have seen advertising for each brand in the last month (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: Have you seen ADVERTISING for any of the following brands in the last month?

name: Buzz vs penetration impact map
helpText: Buzz vs Penetration Impact Map

name: Top of mind - Restaurants
helpText:
The first mention awareness of the restaurant brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents who that answered the survey).
Q: Thinking about restaurants, which names come to mind?

name: Top of mind - Cafes
helpText:
The first mention awareness of the cafe brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents who that answered the survey).
Q: Thinking about cafes, which names come to mind?

name: Top of mind - Delivery
helpText:
The first mention awareness of the delivery brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents who that answered the survey).
Q: Thinking about delivery, which names come to mind?

name: Top of mind - Fast casual
helpText:
The first mention awareness of the fast casual brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents who that answered the survey).
Q: Thinking about places you would go for a quick bite to eat, which names come to mind?

name: Top of mind - Pubs
helpText:
The first mention awareness of the pub brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents who that answered the survey).
Q: Thinking about pubs, which names come to mind?

name: Spontaneous awareness - Restaurants
helpText:
The unprompted awareness of the restaurant brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents who that answered the survey).
Q: Thinking about restaurants, which names come to mind?

name: Spontaneous awareness - Cafes
helpText:
The unprompted awareness of the cafe brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents who that answered the survey).
Q: Thinking about cafes, which names come to mind?

name: Spontaneous awareness - Delivery
helpText:
The unprompted awareness of the delivery brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents who that answered the survey).
Q: Thinking about fast casuals, which names come to mind?

name: Spontaneous awareness - Fast casual
helpText:
The unprompted awareness of the fast casual brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents who that answered the survey).
Q: Thinking about places you would go for a quick bite to eat, which names come to mind?

name: Spontaneous awareness - Pubs
helpText:
The unprompted awareness of the pub brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents who that answered the survey).
Q: Thinking about pubs, which names come to mind?

name: Brand health
helpText: Performance across the factors that capture the knowledge and preference for each brand that can lead to a visit and purchase.

name: Brand health: Brand health scorecard
helpText: Performance across the factors that capture the knowledge and preference for each brand that can lead to a visit and purchase.

name: Awareness
helpText:
The awareness of the brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents who don't state 'I do not know this brand').
Q: When, if ever, have you visited / ordered from the following? (selected aware or ever used)

name: Familiarity
helpText:
The percentage of people who are both aware AND have an opinion of the brand
Q: When, if ever, have you visited / ordered from the following? / Q: What is your overall opinion of the following brands?

name: Affinity
helpText:
The affinity level of the brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents who are familiar with the brand and state they 'love' the brand or 'like it a lot').
Q: How would you describe your opinion of the following brands?

name: Affinity:Affinity (stacked)
helpText:
The affinity level of the brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents who are familiar with the brand and state they 'love' the brand or 'like it a lot').
Q: How would you describe your opinion of the following brands?

name: Consideration
helpText:
The consideration of the brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: Please select all of the brands you would EVER CONSIDER going to eat / order food from

name: Consideration & preference
helpText:
The consideration of the brands and the preference of the brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: Please select all of the brands you would EVER CONSIDER going to eat / order food from / And of the brands you would consider visiting / ordering from, which would describe as your FAVOURITES?

name: Preference
helpText:
The preference of the brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: And of the brands you would consider visiting / ordering from, which would describe as your FAVOURITES?

name: Advantage
helpText:
The level of people stating that a brand is 'one of the best' (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: What is your overall opinion of the following brands?

name: Advantage:Advantage (stacked)
helpText:
The level of people stating that a brand is 'one of the best' (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: What is your overall opinion of the following brands?

name: Preference funnel
helpText: The Preference Funnel shows how well brands convert awareness into consideration and then consideration into preference. It's a visual representation of where brands need to focus marketing activity.

name: Brand advantage vs familiarity impact map
helpText: Brand Advantage vs Familiarity Impact Map

name: Brand advantage vs affinity
helpText: Brand Advantage vs Affinity Impact Map

name: Image
helpText:
Image characteristics most associated with each brand (stated as a percentage of all respondents who are familiar with the brand).
Q: Which of the words / statements do you MOST associate with [BRAND]?

name: Image by consideration
helpText: Image statements split by considerers and non considerers of a given brand

name: Occasions
helpText:
Occasions most associated with each brand (stated as a percentage of all respondents who used the brand in the last 12 months).
Q: Which of the following OCCASIONS do you MOST associate with [BRAND]?

name: Occasions by consideration
helpText: Occasion statements split by considerers and non considerers of a given brand

name: Demand & usage: Demand & usage scorecard
helpText: Performance across the factors that capture the demand for each brand that and visit frequency.

name: Usage funnel
helpText: The Usage Funnel shows how well brands convert awareness into usage and then users into brand advocates. It's a visual representation of where brands need to focus marketing activity.

name: Penetration (L12M)
helpText:
Visited a restaurant / takeaway and purchased in the last 12 months:
Q: When, if ever, have you visited / ordered from the following?

name: Penetration (L3M)
helpText:
Visited a restaurant / takeaway and purchased in the last 3 months:
Q: When, if ever, have you visited / ordered from the following?

name: Penetration (LM)
helpText:
Visited a restaurant / takeaway and purchased in the last month:
Q: When, if ever, have you visited / ordered from the following?

name: Consumer segment
helpText:
Visited a restaurant / takeaway and purchased in the last 12 months, greater than 12 months ago, were aware of a brand, or have never heard of the brand:
Q: When, if ever, have you visited / ordered from the following?

name: Annual frequency
helpText:
The in-store visitation of the brands over the past year (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: How many times have you VISTED / ORDERED from the following brands in the last 12 months?

name: Annual frequency:Annual frequency (stacked)
helpText:
The in-store visitation of the brands over the past year (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: How many times have you VISTED / ORDERED from the following brands in the last 12 months?

name: Rejectors
helpText:
Rejectors of the brand - people that would never consider using a given brand:
Q: Which of the following brands would you NEVER CONSIDER going to eat / order food from?

name: Repertoire
helpText:
The other brands that users of a given brand have used in the last 3 months:
Q: Which, if any, have you VISITED / ORDERED FOOD from in the last 3 months?

name: Lost demand
helpText:
The reasons that one brand was chosen over another:
Q: Earlier you mentioned you were considering [BRAND], when you used / visited {an alternative brand}. What would have motivated you to use / visit [BRAND] instead?

name: Adoption pyramid
helpText: The Adoption Pyramid shows how well brands convert awareness into consideration and then consideration into penetration. It's a visual representation of where brands need to focus marketing activity.

name: Location before visit
helpText: Where did you come from before your visit to BRAND?

name: Level of planning
helpText:
Determining whether the purchase was planned or spontaneous (stated as a percentage of all respondents who used the brand in the last 12 months).
Q: When did you decide to [order from / visit] [BRAND]?

name: Reasons for choosing
helpText:
Reasons for choosing to visit the BRAND
Q: What were the main reasons you chose [BRAND] on your last visit?

name: Reasons for choosing:Reasons for choosing by advocacy
helpText:
Reasons for choosing to visit the BRAND split by advocacy of that brand
Q: What were the main reasons you chose [BRAND] on your last visit?

name: Marketing influence
helpText:
Influence of marketing on the decision making process (stated as a percentage of all respondents who used the brand in the last 12 months).
Q: Did any of the following influence you in choosing [BRAND] on this occasion?

name: Customer experience scorecard
helpText: The level of customer satisfaction and advocacy for the brands.

name: NPS
helpText:
The level of advocacy for the brands by those have been customers in the past 30 days (stated as a Net Promoter Score - the 'percentage of promoters' minus the 'percentage of detractors').
Q: Considering the places you have visited / ordered from, on a scale of 0-10 how likely would you be to recommend them to friends / family?

name: Promoters
helpText:
The level of advocacy for the brands by those have been customers in the past 30 days (stated as a Net Promoter Score - the 'percentage of promoters' minus the 'percentage of detractors').
Q: Considering the places you have visited / ordered from, on a scale of 0-10 how likely would you be to recommend them to friends / family?

name: Passives
helpText:
The level of advocacy for the brands by those have been customers in the past 30 days (stated as a Net Promoter Score - the 'percentage of promoters' minus the 'percentage of detractors').
Q: Considering the places you have visited / ordered from, on a scale of 0-10 how likely would you be to recommend them to friends / family?

name: Detractors
helpText:
The level of advocacy for the brands by those have been customers in the past 30 days (stated as a Net Promoter Score - the 'percentage of promoters' minus the 'percentage of detractors').
Q: Considering the places you have visited / ordered from, on a scale of 0-10 how likely would you be to recommend them to friends / family?

name: Satisfaction
helpText:
Percentage (of those visiting [BRAND] in the last three months) rating their overall satisfaction with their last experience 8-10 on a 0-10 scale.
Q: Thinking about some of the places you have VISITED / ORDERED FOOD in the last three months, how would you rate your level of SATISFACTION with your last experience?

name: Alternative choice
helpText:
Alternative brands considered when visiting a given brand:
Q: Which other brand, if any, did you also consider when you chose to visit / use [BRAND]?

name: Value for money
helpText:
Determining whether people were content with the price they paid (stated as an indexed average score for "Value for Money" on a scale of 0-10).
Q: Based on your last experience at [BRAND], how would you rate on the following factors? - indexed average score for "Value for Money" on a scale of 0-10

name: Bill shock
helpText:
Determining whether people were shocked with the price they paid (stated as a percentage of all respondents who said it was slightly more or a lot more than they expected to pay, as a percentage of the total).
Q: Which of these best describes the price you paid? - Selecting "A lot more" or "Slightly more"

name: Price attractiveness vs recommendation map
helpText:
Price attractiveness vs Recommendation Map (recommendation is % stating 8-10 on a scale of 0-10)
Recommendation Q: Considering the places you have visited / ordered from, on a scale of 0-10 how likely would you be to recommend them to friends / family?

name: Experience
helpText:
Elements of the customer journey scored as an Index:
Q:Based on your last experience at #BRAND#, how would you rate on the following factors?

name: Experience - for reports
helpText:
Elements of the customer journey scored as an Index:
Q:Based on your last experience at #BRAND#, how would you rate on the following factors?
Note: All factors excluding those specific to delivery occasions.

name: Experience by advocacy
helpText:
Elements of the customer journey scored as an Index and split by advocacy:
Q:Based on your last experience at #BRAND#, how would you rate on the following factors?

name: Experience by advocacy - for reports
helpText:
Elements of the customer journey scored as an Index and split by advocacy:
Q:Based on your last experience at #BRAND#, how would you rate on the following factors?
Note: All factors excluding those specific to delivery occasions.

name: Experience scorecard
helpText: The level of frequency and value of purchases made

name: Food
helpText:
Food consumed when visiting [BRAND] (stated as a percentage of all respondents who used the brand in the last 12 months).
Q: What food, if any, did you eat?

name: Drinks
helpText:
Drinks consumed when visiting [BRAND] (stated as a percentage of all respondents who used the brand in the last 12 months).
Q: What drinks, if any, did you have?

name: Length of visit (minutes)
helpText:
Determining how long the visit / order lasted (stated as an average of all respondents who used the brand in the last 12 months).
Q: How long did the occasion last (in minutes)?

name: Spend per person
helpText: The average spend per person per visit for each brand

name: Discount
helpText:
Determining the proportion of people that used a voucher (stated as a percentage of all respondents saying "Yes" vs the total).
Q: Did you use a promotional or discount voucher?

name: Discount driven visits
helpText:
Determining - of people that used a voucher - which people said that they would not have visited without a discount (stated as a percentage of all respondents saying "No - would not have gone there" vs the total).
Q: If you hadn't had that discount would you have still visited / used [BRAND]?

name: Discount type
helpText:
The type of discount each person used on their most recent visit:
Q: Which of the following best describes the  promotional or discount voucher you used?

The type of discount each person used on their most recent visit:

name: Time of day
helpText:
The time of day that each person visited / used each brand:
Q: At what time of day did you visit / use [BRAND]?

name: Time of day - Breakfast (6am-10 am)
helpText:
The percentage of people that visit or use a brand for breakfast (6am-10 am):
Q: At what time of day did you visit / use [BRAND]?

name: Time of day - Mid-morning (10am-12pm)
helpText:
The percentage of people that visit or use a brand mid-morning (10am-12pm):
Q: At what time of day did you visit / use [BRAND]?

name: Time of day - Lunch (12pm-3pm)
helpText:
The percentage of people that visit or use a brand for lunch (12pm-3pm):
Q: At what time of day did you visit / use [BRAND]?

name: Time of day - Afternoon (3pm-5pm)
helpText:
The percentage of people that visit or use a brand in the afternoon (3pm-5pm):
Q: At what time of day did you visit / use [BRAND]?

name: Time of day - Early evening (5pm-7pm)
helpText:
The percentage of people that visit or use a brand in the early evening (5pm-7pm):
Q: At what time of day did you visit / use [BRAND]?

name: Time of day - Evening (after 7pm)
helpText:
The percentage of people that visit or use a brand in the Evening (after 7pm):
Q: At what time of day did you visit / use [BRAND]?

name: Occasion with children
helpText:
The percentage of people that visited / ordered with children:
Q: How many {children} were in the party? (Stating one or more as a percentage of all visits in the last 3 months)

name: Party size
helpText:
The average party size per visit:
Q: How many people were in the party? (As an average of all visits in the last 3 months)

name: Occasion of visit
helpText:
The occasion of the visit
Q: Which best describes the occasion?

name: Lifestage
helpText: The lifestage of the key customers

name: Customer profile
helpText:
The profile of the users of a given brand:
Q: Which of the following restaurants do you visit, or would consider visiting? (% shows all customers)

name: Delivery Awareness
helpText: Which of the following are you aware of offering delivery services?

name: Delivery consideration
helpText: Which of the following would you consider ordering food / drink from that would be delivered to you?

name: Delivery usage
helpText: Which of the following have you ordered food / drink from where it was delivered to you in the last 12 months?

name: Takeaway awareness
helpText: Which of the following are you aware of giving you the option to take food / drink away with you rather than eating at their restaurant / cafe?

name: Takeaway consideration
helpText: Which of the following would you consider buying food / drink from that you takeaway with you?

name: Takeaway usage
helpText: Which of the following have you bought food / drink from to takeaway with you in the last 12 months?

name: Reporting
helpText: Reporting system

name: Compare metrics
helpText: An interface for comparing multiple metrics
